column2: MOVES-BlackRock names Tan-Yuan Kueh head of private bank business Asia ex-JapanBroad commodity ETPs attract strong inflows in July -BlackRockBroad commodity ETPs attract strong inflows in July: BlackRock LONDON Diversified commodity exchange-traded products (ETPs) attracted strong inflows in July as a pick-up in economic growth in China and the United States encouraged investors to return to the unloved asset class.  Broad commodity ETPs attract strong inflows in July: BlackRock LONDON Diversified commodity exchange-traded products (ETPs) attracted strong inflows in July as a pick-up in economic growth in China and the United States encouraged investors to return to the unloved asset class. * Biggest inflows to diversified category in 3 years     * Industrial metals attract a robust $117 mln     * Gold ETPs rebound

column4: Aug 8 Diversified commodity exchange-traded products (ETPs) attracted strong inflows in July as a pick-up in economic growth in China and the United States encouraged investors to return to the unloved asset class. column2: BRIEF-McKesson to pay $18 million to resolve U.S. false claims allegationsMcKesson pays $18 mln in temperature monitor false claims case Aug 8 McKesson Corp agreed to pay $18 million to settle U.S. charges that it violated its contract with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention by falsely assuring that it had been shipping vaccines at the correct temperature. column3: Aug 8 A former Microsoft Corp  employee was sentenced to two years in prison on Friday for his part in an insider trading scheme that netted him and his partner more than $400

column2: MOVES-Northern Trust names Peter Jordan head of Global Fund Services in APAC Aug 8 Northern Trust Corp appointed Peter Jordan as head of its Global Fund Services for the Asia-Pacific region. Earlier

column2: INSIGHT-Pfizer confronts surge of lawsuits over LipitorPfizer confronts surge of lawsuits over Lipitor Pharmaceutical giant Pfizer is facing a mounting wave of lawsuits by women who allege that the company knew about possible serious side effects of its blockbuster anti-cholesterol drug Lipitor but never properly warned the public. Italian holdouts in Argentina debt dispute make play for cash NEW YORK
column3: Aug 8 Italian retirees holding defaulted Argentine debt from 2002 and who spurned Buenos Aires' restructuring offers are seeking to force Bank of New York Mellon to pay out their court judgments from frozen money due holders who accepted the government's terms.

column2: Yahoo to join Google to create spy-free email systems -WSJ Aug 7 Yahoo Inc said it will join Google Inc to create a secure email system by next year that could make it nearly impossible for hackers or government officials to read users' messages
US meat supplier OSI withdraws products made in Shanghai factory HONG KONG
column3: Aug 8 U.S. meat supplier OSI Group LLC is withdrawing products made in a Shanghai factory from undisclosed outlets in the wake of a food safety scare last month that hit fast food chains McDonald's  and Yum Brands Inc's KFC.
